extendedInfo.description: Configure LED color and its flashing frequency for notification as shown below:- Miss call- SMS- MMS- Gmail- Calendar reminder- Hangouts- *Email- *Facebook- *Facebook Messenger- *Twitter- *WhatsApp- *LINE- *GO SMS Pro- *Handcent SMS- *Any 3rd party apps- Low battery- Battery charging- Battery charged- No signal- No 3G/4G- No Wifi- Silent Mode On- Mobile Data On- Wifi On- Bluetooth OnOn Android 4.1 and 4.2, ROOT is required for those mark with asterisk *. After grant the ROOT permission, you need to restart Light Manager for changes to take effect. However ROOT is not required anymore from Android 4.3 onwards. You need to enable the Notification Access for Light Manager.There are two operating modes:1) Normal Mode - Only LED color for the first notification will be flashing2) Alternating Mode - A few LED colors will be flashing alternately when multiple notifications are receivedYou may go to the test section to test whether this app works for your device.For Samsung Galaxy SIII (JB):- Device's screen needs to be turned off in order for the notification LED to work- You need to go to Setting > Display > LED indicator and enable "Notifications" in order for this application to workFor supported devices list and FAQ, you may go to the link below:https://docs.google.com/document/d/1t26evGufoC4Fha1Vjyho1cgBKHY6MLJGBPHcsGKZVLc/edit

reviews.title: Samsung GN2.
reviews.comment: Swiping away a notification doesnt cancle the LED.
reviews.author: Darren Reynolds

reviews.title: SCREEN UNLOCK BROKEN!
reviews.comment: Sry for caps, I don\'t use a lockscreen, security\'s not an issue on this phone. When I turn my screen on, the LED does not stop. I have to actually activate the program to get it to stop. Pulling down the notification bar doesn\'t even work, which makes this worse than the built in manager. Please fix. Galaxy S3.
reviews.author: Anthony Guillen

reviews.title: Worked before the last update
reviews.comment: Update: still requires root for Facebook and most of my other apps. This was not a problem 3 or 4 updates ago now . There is no noticeable change for the better in the app.   Ever since the last update none of my colours show up correctly and now the app requires rooting for all my apps like email and Facebook. I\'m very upset about this.  Samsung Galaxy S3
reviews.author: Demi Smith

reviews.title: Pretty good app
reviews.comment: Would have been full marks if there\'s an option for duration, e.g.: like lighted up, or blink, the particular colour for half an hour & inclusion for Yahoo mail.
reviews.author: Ann Leong

reviews.title: They lied bout 3rd & 4th party apps
reviews.comment: 3rd and 4th party apps not supported still because you must be rooted (UNINSTALL)
reviews.author: Roger Jones

reviews.title: One problem
reviews.comment: LED indicator turns on even when there are no new notifications. Please fix this problem. Thank you
reviews.author: Jamil Shabayta

reviews.title: Inlove
reviews.comment: I absolutely love this app. Just recently I have gotten this galaxy and it helps me so mjch with all the notifications I get. I recommend this to everyone.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Minimal, though could be more minimal for Nexus 4 users, and just works. Free with support for extra apps which is nice.
reviews.author: Nur Burhan

reviews.title: Root?
reviews.comment: It\'s a good app but I dont know how to grant the ROOT permission. Now I can\'t tell when my other apps get notifications.  Help please?
reviews.author: Michael Buford

reviews.title: Works perfect
reviews.comment: Works perfect but worth mentioning anyone running PA 3.94 ROM and having issues check in app privacy and ensure the notification permission is checked. Took me a while to figure out
reviews.author: Alistair Hamlin

reviews.title: Must have for note 2!
reviews.comment: 5 stars,its the best led app out. -..#SZGT
reviews.author: Thomas GEEZS

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Very good for free. Just one bug I noticed: the 3rd custom app doesn\'t show the bar on the right that shows what colour the notification is. Actually, I found a bigger bug: when you turn the screen on when charging and turn it back off the notification doesn\'t come back.
reviews.author: Jarom Leneham

reviews.title: Used to work...
reviews.comment: Used to love this app and now suddenly I have to root all 3rd party apps! Whats up with that? Will probably uninstall because of this :-(
reviews.author: Elmarie Terblanche

reviews.title: Constant Notification (fixed)!
reviews.comment: On android 4.3 it shows a constant notification in the shade area. If I turn it off, the app doesn\'t seem to work.   Also. If I do turn it off, it\'ll come back after reboot.   Google says this is a developer thing designed to make app writers do a better job making any constantly running apps. :(  I hope the dev addresses this soon for 4.3...
reviews.author: Chris S

reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.comment: Working in my S Galaxy Note II, and it is wonderful, Thanks.
reviews.author: Mohamed Nada

reviews.title: Nexus 4
reviews.comment: After the fix it seems to work great on 4.3 update.
reviews.author: Omar Hernandez

reviews.title: The proper colors won\'t flash.
reviews.comment: My Nexus 4 is rooted and the app worked fine since your latest update, but now the proper color won\'t flash for the Facebook Messenger app. It flashes green instead of blue. There\'s a red \"notification access required\" icon and I enabled it in the settings, but it still doesn\'t flash the proper color. I\'ve uninstalled/installed the app twice and rebooted my phone twice. The red \"notification access required\" icon is still showing even though I\'ve granted it access; is the icon permanent or is it supposed to disappear after being granted access?
reviews.author: Elisha Loewen

reviews.title: It works fine
reviews.comment: Some colors are a little off for S4, few apps are supported if you don\'t root your phone
reviews.author: Shirley Montealegre

reviews.title: Awesome! BUT creates a wakelock :S
reviews.comment: By far the most PERFECT working LED control for 4.3 and android in general! The only (ONLY!) one downside is that it creates a wakelock called \"Audioout_2\". I uninstalled the app and it was gone! So, pretty much this is the culprit. How can I stop this? Or a new update regarding this matter would be highly appreciated... Thanks for the wonderful app.
reviews.author: Wasif Saleem

reviews.title: Works Great
reviews.comment: I love this app and always used it since it was first released. I always found it to work better and easier than lightflow. It just works without tons of useless complex settings.
reviews.author: Greg Russell
